The Chapter with Kaccāyana
The Elder Mahākaccāyana’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
the one without passion, the undefeated victor,
a leader arose in this world🔽after a hundred thousand eons.

analyzed: vīro kamala pattakkho  sa saṅka vimala ānanaḥ
translated: The hero with eyes like lotus petals,🔽with a face pure and spotless,
shining like a golden mountain,
with a radiance like the sun’s light.
Charming the hearts of the seven eyes,
adorned with the excellent characteristics,
beyond all verbal paths,
honored by humans, immortals, and Sakka.
The Fully Awakened One, teaching beings,
with a melodious and sweet voice,
with a stream of compassion,
confident in the assemblies.
He teaches the sweet Dhamma,

translated: connected with the four truths;🔽he rescues beings
who are sunk in the mud of delusion.
At that time, wandering alone,
a sage in the Himalayas,
traveling through the sky🔽to the human world, I saw the Victor.
Approaching him,
I listened to the teaching of the Dhamma;
while praising the hero’s
great qualities as a disciple.
‘What was said by me in brief,
Explaining in detail;
He delights the assembly,
Just as this Kaccāyana does.

analyzed: na aham evam idha ekat ca  aññam passāmi sāvaka
translated: I do not see any other disciple🔽Like this one in this respect.
Therefore, at the top is Esagga,
Thus remember it, monks.’
Then, being delighted,
Having heard the delightful words;

translated: Having gone to the Himalayas,🔽Having gathered flowers,
Having worshipped the refuge of the world,🔽I aspired for that state;
Then, knowing my aspiration,
The one who has abandoned passion declared:
‘See that lord of seers,

translated: With skin the colour of refined gold;
With hair standing on end, well-nourished,
Standing with joined palms unmoving.

analyzed: hāsam su puṇṇa nayana  buddha vaṇṇa gata asaya
translated: With eyes full of tears,🔽With a mind gone to the Buddha’s appearance,
With a heart of joy in the Dhamma,
Like one clothed in the deathless.’
Having heard Kaccāyana’s qualities,
Aspiring for that state, I stood there;
In the future time,
Of the great sage Gotama.

analyzed: tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ  orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: The heir to his Dhamma,🔽Embodied in his heart,
By the name of Kaccāyana,
will be a disciple of the Teacher.
Learned, of great wisdom,
and skilled in the Muni’s intentions,
he will attain that state,
just as I have declared.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
the deed I did then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I transmigrate through two existences,
among gods and humans;
I do not go to another destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I am born into two families,
among nobles and brahmins;
I am not born into a low family,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
And in my last existence now,
I was born in the city of Ujjenī,
of Pajjota and Caṇḍa,
the chief priest of the king.
The son of Triṭivaccha,
skilled, having mastered the Vedas,
my mother was named Candimā,
I was Kaccāna, of beautiful skin.
For the purpose of testing the Buddha,
sent by Bhūmipāla,
seeing the gate of liberation,
the leader, the one with accumulated qualities.
And hearing the pure speech,
purifying the mire of destinies,
I attained the Deathless peace,
Together with the other seven.
I became one who knows the purport,
Of the Sugata of great wisdom;
I was placed in the foremost position,
My mind was well-developed.
My defilements were burned up,
All my existences were destroyed;
Like an elephant who has broken his bonds,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed it was to me,
To come into the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
The Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
And the eight liberations as well;
The six direct knowledges have been realized,
The Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus did the Elder Maha Kaccana recite this verse.
